  • Constructor Details

    • Minesweeper

      public Minesweeper(int height, int width, int numBombs, MinesweeperUIBuilder uiBuilder)
      Constructor for starting a new game of Minesweeper.
      Parameters:
      height - The height of the game grid.
      width - The width of the game grid.
      numBombs - The number of bombs within the grid.
      uiBuilder - updates the appearance of the game grid as you play.

  • Method Details

    • initializeBoard

      public void initializeBoard()
      Sets the starting parameters of the new game board.

    • randomizeAndPlaceBombs

      public void randomizeAndPlaceBombs()
      Randomly place bombs on the new game board.

    • calculateNeighbors

      private void calculateNeighbors()
      Private method used to determine the number of bombs surrounding each Cell.

    • showAllBombsForDebugging

      private void showAllBombsForDebugging(boolean weAreDebugging)
      Basically just a cheat code to view the bombs on screen while you're playing...er, I mean "debugging."
      Parameters:
      weAreDebugging - Class level parameter. Set it to true if you want to see the bombs as you're playing.

    • processCellLeftClick

      public void processCellLeftClick(javafx.scene.control.Button cellButton)
      Change the game state after you left-click on a Cell Button.
      Parameters:
      cellButton - The Button you clicked on the game board.

    • processCellRightClick

      public void processCellRightClick(javafx.scene.control.Button cellButton)
      Game logic to run when the user right-clicks on a button on the game grid. This was moved into its own method because the left-click method was getting complicated.
      Parameters:
      cellButton - The button that was right-clicked.

    • processCellMiddleClick

      public void processCellMiddleClick(javafx.scene.control.Button cellButton)
      Game logic to run when the user middle clicks (or left+right clicks) a button on the game grid. Essentially just left-clicks all neighbor cells that are not flagged as bombs.
      Parameters:
      cellButton - The button that was clicked.

    • floodFill

      private void floodFill(Cell cell)
      Recursive method to mark an entire section of the game board as revealed if you find a cell that has no bombs as neighbors.
      Parameters:
      cell - The cell with no bombs as neighbors.

    • countFlaggedNeighbors

      private int countFlaggedNeighbors(Cell cell)
      Helper method to count the number of cells around the given cell that have been flagged as bombs.
      Parameters:
      cell - The game cell whose neighbors we're checking.
      Returns:
      The number of cells that have been flagged as bombs.

    • isInBounds

      private boolean isInBounds(int row, int col)
      Helper method to determine if a cell is in bounds before taking action on it.
      Parameters:
      row - The row of the cell to check.
      col - the column of the cell the check.
      Returns:
      true if the cell is in bounds, false if it is not.

    • registerCellButton

      public void registerCellButton(javafx.scene.control.Button cellButton, Cell cell)
      Register each Button and Cell into the game grid, so they can be checked as you play.
      Parameters:
      cellButton - The Button to be registered in the game grid.
      cell - The Cell to be registered in the game grid.

    • initializeGameOverState

      private void initializeGameOverState(boolean youWon)
      Pain and suffering (aka you clicked a mine). Reveal the entire board and remind you which cell you screwed up at.
